New Records: The White Sox established a franchise record with their 107th loss
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea pitched 7 shutout innings with 2 hits, 2 walks, and 5 strikeouts
Reed Garrett and Edwin Diaz combined to work the final 2 innings scoreless
Francisco Lindor hit a solo home run in the 4th inning
Starling Marte singled leading off the 5th and got picked off first
Lindor hit 4 home runs on the road trip
Lindor extended his on-base streak to 30 games, the longest active in the major leagues
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets arrived on the South Side with no other acceptable option but to sweep the White Sox
The Mets won 7 of 10 games on the three-city jaunt and returned home within a game of the Braves for the final NL wild-card spot
Post-Match Reflections: Manaea said 'We have definitely set ourselves up for a good run here'
Lindor said 'We are in a good spot. We’re in the same spot that we were before the road trip. It’s in a position that we still have a chance for the playoffs.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets scored only 12 runs over the three games at Guaranteed Rate Field
Garrett Crochet tied a White Sox record by striking out 7 straight batters to begin his start
Crochet struck out 8 batters over 3 ¹/₃ innings
The Mets had their own offensive struggles, striking out 16 times
Others: The White Sox remain on pace to supplant the 1962 Mets (who lost 120 games) as the worst team in MLB history
Manaea threw 67 percent sinkers, a pitch that he’s used about 40 percent of the time for the entire season
